com.tooltwist.xdata
Interface XSelector

All Known Implementing Classes:
DomXml, DomXmlList, FastJson, FastJsonNodes, FastXml, FastXmlNodes, XD
public interface XSelector

A class that implements this interface can be used to access individual data elements, using the XData API. This interface automatically implies implementation of Iterable and Iterator, meaning that the object can be used in standard Java iterations. Note that the definition of next() provided here is different to that in XData#next().

Author:
philipcallender

first

Re-start from the first element in the list.

hasNext

boolean hasNext()
Returns:
True if there is another element in the selection.

next

boolean next()
Advance the internal pointer to the next element in this selection.

currentName

String currentName()
Return the name of the field currently selected. For example, if you used select("/* /customer") to get this XDSelector object, then the field name will be "customer".

Returns:

currentIndex

int currentIndex()
Return the index of the field currently selected. While iterating through a selection, this counts through the items in the selection, starting at zero.

Returns:

setCurrentIndex

boolean setCurrentIndex(int index)
                        throws XDException
Set the position in the current list. Returns false if the index is invalid.

select

XSelector select(String xpath)
                 throws XDException
Select a list. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 XDSelector list = data.select("/* /product");
 while (list.next()) {
        String description = list.string("description");
 }

Parameters:
xpath -

foreach

void foreach(String xpath,
             Object userData,
             XDCallback callback)
             throws XDException
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 MyData myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
     MyData myData = (MyData) data;
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

Parameters:

callback -

void foreach(String xpath,
             XDCallback callback)
             throws XDException
Iterate through matching items using a callback object to handle each item. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 Object myData = ...;
 data.select("/* /product", myData, new XDCallback() {
   @Override 
   public void next(IXData item, int index, Object data) throws XDataNotFoundException, XDataException {
           String description = item.string("description");
   }
 });

foreach

Iterable<XSelector> foreach(String xpath)
                            throws XDException
Iterate through items using Iterable notation. For example: 
 XData data = ...;
 for (IXData item : data.foreach("/* /product")) {
        String description = item.string("description");
 }
